shoot up.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to increase very quickly and suddenly
shoot up.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Demand for water has shot up by 70% over the last 30 years.
shoot up.translation[0].definitions[1].d: if a child shoots up, he or she grows taller very quickly and suddenly
shoot up.translation[0].definitions[1].e: I can’t believe this is Joshua – he’s shot up since we last saw him!
shoot up.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to cause serious injury or damage to someone or something by shooting them with bullets
shoot up.translation[0].definitions[2].e: Then two men came in and shot up the entire lobby.
shoot up.translation[0].definitions[3].d: to put illegal drugs into your blood, using a needle
shoot up.translation[0].definitions[3].e: Kids as young as ten are shooting up heroin.
shoot up.translation[1].definitions[0].d: to quickly increase in number or amount
shoot up.translation[1].definitions[0].e: Prices have certainly shot up recently.
